article.headline: Butler 68, Quincy 54
article.story: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) -- Duane Lightfoot scored 12 points and Mike Monserez grabbed 10 rebounds and had nine assists to lead Butler to a 68-54 win over Quincy in the Bulldogs' season opener Sunday night. Lightfoot was among four players in double figures for the Bulldogs (1-0), who are looking to improve on their NCAA Tournament run from a year ago. Avery Sheets scored 12 points, James Parker had 11 and Jeff James added 10 on 3-of-3 shooting. Cory Cummens was the only player to score in double figures for Quincy (2-1). He had 23 points, including 9-of-10 from the free-throw line, but did most of his scoring the first half. Butler opened the game with an 18-8 run and led by as many as 13 before going into halftime leading 35-26. The Hawks, held to just 38 percent shooting, never got closer than seven points after that. Brandon Crone was 2-of-2 from 3-point range to pace the Bulldogs to a 6-of-15 mark in the first half. They went just 3-for-10 the rest of the way.
